content.full_text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Reuben  F. Ruth, 28 September 18571 Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance Company, Pay toR. F. Ruth.or BearerFourteen70/100Dollars, IN CURRENT BANK NOTES. $14–702
paragraphs: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Reuben  F. Ruth, 28 September 18571
citations: Daily Illinois State Journal(Springfield), 21 August 1857, 4:1; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 166.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln filled in the blanks of this partially printed check and signed it.

2It is unknown what this payment from Lincoln to Reuben F. Ruth was for, but it may
                  have been related to Ruth’s business as a harness-maker, saddler, and trunk manufacturer.
                  The funds were withdrawn from Lincoln’s account at the Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance
                  Company on September 30, 1857. He wrote another check to Ruth in 1859.Daily Illinois State Journal(Springfield), 21 August 1857, 4:1; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 166.

structured_content.text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Reuben  F. Ruth, 28 September 18571
